title: Life 360 Not Updating Location? 10 Troubleshooting Tips

steps.title: Close the app and open it again.
steps.content: Close the app and open it again. Sometimes, a quick app restart can fix minor software bugs. On iPhone, swipe up from the bottom (or double-press the Home button) and swipe up on the app. On Android, swipe up from the bottom, hold, and then release. Swipe up on the app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure the app is up-to-date.
steps.content: Make sure the app is up-to-date. Open the Google Play Store or App Store and search for Life360. If there's an update available, you'll see Update .

steps.title: Turn off your device and turn it on again.
steps.content: Turn off your device and turn it on again. If the app still isn't updating, try powering down your device fully. Wait a minute, and then turn it on again.

steps.title: Make sure your Wi-Fi network is online.
steps.content: Make sure your Wi-Fi network is online. If you're having trouble connecting to Wi-Fi, make sure the network is stable and active. If it isn't, you may need to restart your router . If you're using cellular, make sure your provider isn't having an outage and your account is active.

steps.title: Disable any active VPN services.
steps.content: Disable any active VPN services. A VPN can interfere with location services. Turn it off, restart your device, and then check Life360 again.

steps.title: Make sure your account is active.
steps.content: Make sure your account is active. You need an active subscription and account to use Life360. Confirm your membership is still active and that you're signed into the correct account.

steps.title: Turn Precise Location on.
steps.content: Turn Precise Location on. This can be found in Life360's settings. Do the following: Open Settings . Scroll down and tap Life360 . Toggle on Precise Location .

steps.title: Enable Background App Refresh.
steps.content: Enable Background App Refresh. This setting allows apps to run in the background without stopping. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap General . Tap Background App Refresh . Tap Background App Refresh again. Tap Wi-Fi or Wi-Fi & Cellular Data .

steps.title: Turn off Low Power Mode.
steps.content: Turn off Low Power Mode. Since Low Power Mode reduces functions to optimize performance, it may affect Life360's location tracking. To turn off Low Power mode , do the following: Open Settings . Tap Battery . Toggle off Low Power Mode .

steps.title: Make sure Location Sharing is enabled.
steps.content: Make sure Location Sharing is enabled. This permission is required to share your location with apps such as Life360. Do the following: Open Settings . Tap Privacy & Security . Tap Location Services . Toggle on Location Services .
